title: Firefox does not respond to a search request
content: Firefox does not respond to a search request. After closing, a restart is answered by an error message - "Firefox is already running. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." When this is done, another instance of Firefox displays. It appears that two instances of Firefox have opened when only one was requested and the second has somehow disabled the search request, either manual (direct) or from a separate application/link. I have completed a Refresh without any change in behaviour. What can I do now? Thank you Graham Garden
creator: grahamgarden

title: Firefox 一直無法結束,重新案裝後如何匯入舊的 Firefox 資料
content: Firefox 一直無法結束,怎修付都沒用,重新安裝也不行,但在桌面留有"舊的 Firefox 資料"的資料夾. 現在Firefox 已重新安裝OK,請問要怎麼匯入"舊的 Firefox 資料"
creator: darleh00

title: "Pause notifications until Firefox restarts" no longer visible or available in Firefox 90.0, what are some other possible options?
content:
I am trying to disable Firefox notifications whenever I take screenshots, and googling for solutions, I found the commonly suggested solution is to uncheck the "Pause notifications until Firefox restarts" box in Permissions:

[to turn off forever the "screenshot" splash notification]

[Copied" window]

This option is not available in my browser version; thus, I'm hoping there's a newer workaround for this.
creator: 0zen

title: Se produjo un fallo por motivos desconocidos al guardar la copia de seguridad del archivo PKCS #12.
content: Se produjo un fallo por motivos desconocidos al guardar la copia de seguridad del archivo PKCS #12.

title: The menus are short, with a scroll bar, in dual monitor setup
content:
I have just set up a second screen hooked up to my laptop, and the external monitor was set as my primary screen. But, I notice that whenever Firefox is on my in-built laptop (secondary) monitor, the firefox menu, as well as all the extension menus, are really short. The firefox menu at least has a scroll bar, but the others are unusable.

I tried disabling hardware acceleration (which, based on other questions, seems to fix certain other dual monitor weirdness around menus), but it did nothing. Any tips?

Thanks in advance.
creator: theo.bendit
